code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:F ophthalmologist aged 47 ys complains of recurrent mild non pruritic rash over the past month. The patient reports mild easy bruising, mild menorrhagia, Blood. she denies smoking Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol o:Height 67 in, Weight 154 lbs, Temperature 99 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 14, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed dexamethasone - 40 mg daily x 4 days, and ordered CBC.

s:a 48 yr old white female presents with 8 months history of mild menorrhagia. Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol denies any smoking o:Height 67 in, Weight 156 lbs, Temperature 97.9 F, Pulse 73, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 16, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed dexamethasone - 40 mg daily x 4 days, and ordered CBC.
